alert.note: Alert for Grant; Natchitoches; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 2:28AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Grant, eastern Natchitoches and central Winn Parishes through 330 AM CDT... At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Campti to Montgomery to Flatwoods. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winnfield, Colfax, Montgomery, Clarence, Pollock, Dry Prong, Calvin, Atlanta, Cloutierville, Hudson, Chopin, St. Maurice, Bentley, Joyce, Lake Iatt, Clear Lake, Aloha, Fishville and Williana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
